TopicTitle: US Supreme Court rule that the FCC does not have the authority to impose net nutralit

Articles.Content:
So ya this is a big freaking deal.

The internet will either completely change or things will go on business as usual.

There still is hope though if a bill could get throuh congress supporting net neutrality since the court only ruled the FCC didn't have the regulatory authority to enforce net neutrality..... Yet.

If you live in the US call your congressmen.

Now discuss.

*bumpbumpbump*

Sign some petitions and preserve the internet:

Petition 1

Petition 2
Thanks. Already did so AND I recommend that those in the US also contact their representatives about it.
How many times are they going to try and fail at moderating the Internet? They've failed at least three times already, just give up...
Good luck at getting the entire world to join in on this. This is basically like saying: "Hey, you know how the universe is expanding? Lets stop it."

So ya this is a big freaking deal... If you live in the US call your congressmen.

Big freaking deal.

Australia had this at one point, but it turned into a scandal once the list of blocked websites was found by someone doing an "Inspect Element" on the page. It eventually got reversed, and everything got back to normal.
